nodes.bodyText:
few things:

method name should start with verb, like create
I don't like this static method, because it will make it hard to mock during testing. Maybe moving this logic into a converter component would make it easier to mock and test
missing tests
Fixed. Also, instead of moving to a provider I ended up put the logic in a UmsCredentialProvider which also makes the grpc call.

doesn't quite feel right in the FreeIpaClient class. We will also likely start checking other object classes as well.
I suggest pulling this out into a separate class. Maybe FreeIpaObjectClasses or FreeIpaCapabilities
Moved it into a FreeIpaCapabilities class. I assume you meant we still want it in the freeipa client package.
Let's add a log message here also. This will let us search to logs for whether anyone is using the "old way"
I like the re-wording. it's clearer
the comment seems wrong. Maybe say "Attribute name to store users passwords ...."

This class only provides static methods and should not be instantiated, hence private constructor. There are other utility classes in this package do the same. Actually I'll remove the comment so that it's consistent with those classes.

I assume that the userCrn is the actor for which the password is set? and that is extracted from the authentication context? Maybe call this actorCrn as the caller maybe a machine user? Also, how do you know the username at this point? This is the workload username, right?

Yes userCrn is the actor for which the password is set and is pulled from authentication context. Changing it to actorCrn does make sense though I'm seeing userCrn be used for both user and machine user in other places in this package. I think we can leave at as userCrn for now, since we will probably deprecate this path once single user sync is in.
The username is the workload username, the existing code calls ums to get the workload username from ums. See PasswordService.getUserIdFromUserCrn(...)
So not you, but there are nicer ways to do this, like using guava object helper.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -43,6 +50,7 @@ public String toString() {
                 + "stackId='" + getResourceId() + '\''
                 + "environment='" + environment + '\''
                 + "username='" + username + '\''
+                + "userCrn='" + userCrn + '\''

nodes.bodyText: Ah nice one. I'll try it out on new classes. And I'll keep this one the same for consistency.

                 + "environment='" + environment + '\''
                 + "username='" + username + '\''
+                + "userCrn='" + userCrn + '\''

nodes.bodyText: I could swear that I've seen this code before.

Well this was extracted off of UmsUsersStateProvider, and thanks to your comment I just realized I forgot remove it from there since it's no longer used (weird that code quality doesn't complain about unused functions).
